page.title: 06LAMRIDDEN DAIRY FARM, DALRY
page.content: The heavy clay soils of the Dalry region promote grass growth ,which is the basis of dairy farming. Lamridden is a 180 acre farm,rented on the Blair Estate,for over Â£4000 a year. 54{Friesian cows}are milked twice a day,yielding 276,000 litres of milk a year.The Milk Marketing Board take the milk to Paisley for bottling, or Mauchline for butter and cheese making.The cattle,indoors from October till May,with about 50 heifers,are fed silage,hay and "cattlecake". About 44 acres are cut for{silage,}20 acres for{hay and barley,}50 acres are {grazed}by milk cows, and 30 acres are{rough grazing.}The barley yield is about 2 tons per acre. The farmer and his family work a 14 hour day, and at harvest time 8 workers and contractors help. Because of EEC limits on milk output, a few{beef cattle}are kept.
